messages.subject: Re: HS test results
messages.msgSnippet: Here s a link to an article about the Rudner report. http://www.geocities.com/Athens/Atlantis/8616/HSLDASTUDY.html It s a much different view of what this
messages.messageBody:
Here's a link to an article about the Rudner report.

http://www.geocities.com/Athens/Atlantis/8616/HSLDASTUDY.html

It's a much different view of what this study is and does.
----- Original Message -----
From: Carolyn Talarr <talarr@...>
To: <Unschooling-dotcom@onelist.com>
Sent: Monday, October 25, 1999 1:53 PM
Subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] HS test results


Hi--

I remember hearing about this study but I'd never seen it.

Interesting results (not surprising!:))--yet I remember people on a list I
was on saying that the religious-affiliation demographics, among others,
were skewed by the fact that Bob Jones University was involved. Lots and
lots of home/unschooling people I know said they would have opted out of
such a study because they didn't want to be affiliated with that particular
institution...

Now if they had a non-religious organization collecting the data, the
demographics might be quite different, and a picture of homeschoolers as
more varied in their makeup might have emerged...

Thanks for passing it along--
Carolyn
-----Original Message-----
From: Sandy Kent <kentsx3@...>
To: RUL@onelist.com <RUL@onelist.com>; Unschooling-dotcom@onelist.com
<Unschooling-dotcom@onelist.com>; unschooling@onelist.com
<unschooling@onelist.com>
Date: Monday, October 25, 1999 10:11 AM
Subject: [Unschooling-dotcom] HS test results


Check this out.:

http://epaa.asu.edu/epaa/v7n8/

Sandy

Hi--

I remember hearing about this study but I'd never seen it.

Interesting results (not surprising!:))--yet I remember people on a list I was on saying that the religious-affiliation demographics, among others, were skewed by the fact that Bob Jones University was involved. Lots and lots of home/unschooling people I know said they would have opted out of such a study because they didn't want to be affiliated with that particular institution...

Now if they had a non-religious organization collecting the data, the demographics might be quite different, and a picture of homeschoolers as more varied in their makeup might have emerged...

Thanks for passing it along--
